column4: Trying to run UT2004 I get 'Couldn't set video mode: Couldn't find matching GLX visual' - but I have the nVidia drivers installed and runnign
Trying to run UT2004 I get 'Couldn't set video mode: Couldn't find matching GLX visual' - but I have the nVidia drivers installed and running
sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf and change "nv" in the video driver section to "nvidia"
I said, I am using the nvidia drivers. That's not it.
just because the nvidia drivers are installed doesn't mean xorg.conf gets updated automatically
I know, but xorg is right.
have you checked to make sure the option to load glx is uncommented in xorg.conf, as well as leaving dri *COMMENTED*
lemme find my xorg.conf and it'll show you how i had my system set up with an nvidia running a monitor + tv as well as an old ati card for a second monitor...
there's part of the problem.  too many device sections.  only need one per head
Yes, it appears to have created more devices.
take twinview out of the monitor's options as well
nvidia card powering monitor and tv out, secondary ati card for second monitor
Yeah, I can't see anything you have done that I havn't that would effect it...
